intro: Uraria lagopoda, commonly known as the goat’s rue, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It is a shrub or perennial herb that typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant features trifoliate leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in racemes. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are often used in traditional medicine. The plant has adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and is drought-tolerant.
